page.title: 10CALLINGTON INDUSTRY
page.content: The biggest industrial employer in Callington is a manufacturer of {Cornish pasties and pies}which are dispatched daily by road all over the UK.This factory occupies several sites on the{Moss Side industrial estate next to it is a firm of precision engineers, the oldest surviving Callington industry, which occupies a building of the wartime POW camp. Behind are small workshops which house {1 bakery,3 light engineering works and {3 motor works. A mile away, past Dupath Farm, a {printing concern}established in 1968 now employs 20 and specialises in {books, magazines and packaging. Several engineering concerns are based at Kelly Bray, but there is also an old-established{family bakery}and an {egg producer}with battery houses and packing unit.
